4113: For a Markov operator $\Psi$ with stationary distribution $\pi$, define the discrete Dirichlet form:
4114: 
4115: $$
4116: \mathcal{E}_{\Psi}(f, f) := \mathbb{E}_\pi[(f - \Psi f)^2]
4117: $$

hints.label: thm-discrete-lsi-hybrid
hints.title: Discrete-Time LSI
hints.content:
4123: :label: thm-discrete-lsi-hybrid
4124: 
4125: If a Markov operator $\Psi$ satisfies the contraction:
4126: 
4127: $$
4128: D_{\text{KL}}(\Psi \# \mu \| \pi) \leq (1 - \epsilon) D_{\text{KL}}(\mu \| \pi) + C
4129: $$
4130: 
4131: for some $\epsilon > 0$, then $\Psi$ satisfies a discrete-time Log-Sobolev inequality:
4132: 
4133: $$
4134: D_{\text{KL}}(\mu \| \pi) \leq \frac{1}{\epsilon} \text{Ent}_\pi[\mu] + \frac{C}{\epsilon}
4135: $$
4136: 
4137: where $\text{Ent}_\pi[\mu]$ is the relative entropy production.
